title: Sources: Trump wants D.C. stadium named for him
content: A senior White House source said there have been back-channel communications with a member of the Commanders ownership group, led by Josh Harris, to express Trump's desire to have the $3.7 billion domed stadium in the nation's capital bear his name.

title: Kyler future in limbo as key Cards decision looms
content: The Cardinals must decide by this offseason whether to try to trade Kyler Murray, release him or pay another $19.5 million in guaranteed money that becomes due on the fifth day of the new league year.

title: Poll: Mendoza top vote-getter as NFL draft's QB1
content: In the latest poll of 25 NFL scouts and executives about who will be the first quarterback taken in the 2026 NFL draft, Indiana's Fernando Mendoza was the top vote-getter with 13, putting him ahead of Oregon's Dante Moore (6) and Alabama's Ty Simpson (3).

title: Norris wins sprint, extends lead as Piastri crashes
content: Oscar Piastri dramatically crashed out of Saturday's Interlagos as title rival and Lando Norris claimed the full haul of points with a decisive victory.

title: Sources: Japanese home run king Murakami posts
content: Japanese star third baseman Munetaka Murakami, who owns the single-season home run record for a Japanese player in Nippon Professional Baseball, is entering the posting system for MLB teams, sources told ESPN.

title: Dodgers' Vesia says baby daughter died Oct. 26
content: Dodgers reliever Alex Vesia, who missed the World Series because of what the team said at the time was a "deeply personal family matter," said Friday that his daughter, Sterling, died Oct. 26.

title: USC QB pulls off fake wearing punter's number
content: USC pulled off a remarkable fake punt against Northwestern by sending out third-string quarterback Sam Huard in the same uniform number as the Trojans' punter.

title: Washington GK Hamant dies of cancer at age 21
content: Mia Hamant, a goalkeeper for Washington's women's soccer team who helped the Huskies reach the semifinals of the Big Ten tournament, has died at age 21.

title: üèÄ Latest NBA intel on futures of Ja, Zion, Trae
content: How close are the Grizz, Pelicans and Hawks to trading their stars? Is Giannis Watch over? Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst have the latest.

title: Ready for Week 10? We have NFL sleepers, QB questions, trends to watch and more
content: Will J.J. McCarthy work more outside the pocket? How will Sauce Gardner fare in his Colts debut? Upset brewing in Patriots-Bucs? Here's what to know for Week 10.

title: How Mizzou beats A&M, the biggest Big 12 game in years, a test for Oregon, and more
content: A top-10 meeting in Lubbock, an upset bid in Iowa City and a pair of SEC tests headline the weekend slate.

title: Chaotic Man United vs. Spurs finale another roller coaster of emotions for fans
content: Tottenham fans thought their team had come from behind to beat Manchester United, only to concede a 96th-minute equalizer in a 2-2 draw.

title: In search of the real Nikola Jokiƒá
content: A trip to Sombor, Serbia, paints a portrait of the elusive Nuggets star by the people who know him best.

title: Best October players, greatest games, bonkers moments and more
content: We celebrate the past 30 years of playoff baseball with a look back at some of the most memorable moments since the wild-card era began.

title: Buzz: When can we expect Puka Nacua, Brock Purdy back in lineup?
content: What fantasy managers need to know about Puka Nacua, Brock Purdy and when each could be back in the lineup.

title: How the Jets, trying to overturn years of misery, made franchise-altering moves in less than two hours
content: With much of the Jets organization at Nick Mangold's funeral, a pair of big trades were in the works 2 miles away.

title: 15 NFL experts, 15 midseason predictions: We made our best calls for tight playoff races, more
content: Can the Bucs reach the Super Bowl? Will Myles Garrett win DPOY? We asked 15 experts to give their predictions for the rest of the season.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è Winners, losers of a wild NFL trade deadline
content: Well, things escalated quickly. Which teams made the best -- and worst -- moves before the NFL trade deadline? We're making sense of all the action.

title: üí∞ Best fits for top MLB free agents
content: Free agency starts at 5 p.m. ET Thursday. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: üìà Ohio St., IU, Texas A&M, Bama top CFP ranking
content: In the first rankings of the College Football Playoff, coach Ryan Day and unbeaten Ohio State topped the list, followed by Big Ten foe Indiana at No. 2 with Texas A&M third and Alabama landing at four.

title: ‚öæ Former MLB star Strawberry pardoned by Trump
content: President Donald Trump has pardoned former MLB great Darryl Strawberry, the 1983 NL Rookie of the Year and an eight-time All-Star, of tax evasion and drug charges dating back to the latter part of his playing career.

title: Early takeaways: Hidalgo is Notre Dame's singular star, UConn can run it back
content: UConn? As good as expected. Tennessee? Still chasing elite status. And Notre Dame? Heavily reliant on Hannah Hidalgo.

title: The best power conference in men's basketball will surprise you
content: Which league will produce a national champion? We track power conferences on the road to the Final Four.

title: Arsenal needed to beat Chelsea, but poor officiating made it hard
content: Arsenal vs. Chelsea should have been a WSL spectacle. But it was ruined by some poor decisions from the officials.

title: New champ, McIntyre suspended, what now for Rhodes?
content: Friday's "SmackDown" left us a new women's champ and questions about the future of the Undisputed WWE Championship.

title: Vergil Ortiz Jr. vs. Erickson Lubin: Five things to know
content: Can Vergil Ortiz Jr. win his first world title? Will Erickson Lubin test Ortiz and finally win the "big fight"?

title: Jake Paul's new fight wish list: Canelo Alvarez, Ryan Garcia, more
content: Jake Paul has fought six fighters off his wish list of 12. Now the YouTuber-turned-boxer shares a new list.

title: Forget police security, they didn‚Äôt even file an FIR despite threats to my life: Rana Ayyub
content: Journalist¬†Rana¬†Ayyub, who¬†has been facing online harassment and doxed by ‚ÄòHindu nationalist handles‚Äô for years, speaks of the latest threat she‚Äôs facing

title: Cong fighting same battle against 'Modi empire' that Mahatma Gandhi fought against British: Priyanka
content: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra addresses back-to-back rallies in Bihar‚Äôs Katihar, Bhagalpur, and Purnea districts, jabs the NDA government over ‚Äòkatta‚Äô remarks, unemployment and more

title: Implementation of projects signed in ‚ÄòRising Rajasthan‚Äô being expedited
content: The three-day investment summit held in Jaipur from December 9 to 11, 2024 had facilitated the signing of MoUs worth ‚Çπ35 lakh crore.

title: Congress chief rubbishes claims of NDA victory in Bihar, cites ‚Äò400-plus rhetoric‚Äô ahead of LS polls
content: Kharge insisted that ‚Äúall was not well‚Äù in the BJP-led coalition, as there were doubts that Nitish Kumar, the JD(U) president and longest-serving Chief Minister, would be backed for another term in office

title: What is your ‚Äògut feeling‚Äô about mental health?
content: Experts at Manotsava, the mental health festival under way in Bengaluru, spoke about emerging research that is validating the traditional wisdom that good digestion is the foundation of both physical and emotional health

title: 88,000 ‚Äòinfiltrators sent back‚Äô during 10-year UPA regime, claims Digvijaya Singh
content: Criticising the ongoing second phase of SIR taking place across many States, including Madhya Pradesh, the Congress leader says the BJP-led Centre has only been able to find 2,400 infiltrators for repatriation in 11 years

title: New vessel rules to promote workers‚Äô cooperatives in fishing sector
content: The rules will ‚Äònot only facilitate deep-sea fishing but will also contribute to enhancing seafood exports by emphasising value addition, traceability, and certification‚Äô, the Union Fisheries Ministry said

title: Skill development institute to be set up at an investment of ‚Çπ100 crore
content: The institute is being set up to help students and job aspirants to develop their skills, considering the proximity to major industrial units in Kalamassery like FACT, TCC, BPCL, and Cochin Shipyard Limited, says Kerala Industries Minister

title: Buddha relics reach Bhutan as India‚Äôs ‚Äògift‚Äô for Global Peace Prayer Festival
content: Thousands of Buddhists from the Himalayan country and beyond have converged for mass prayers for peace on earth

title: In Bihar‚Äôs villages, microfinance has changed from a promise of empowerment to a deadly debt trap
content: Bihar holds 15% of India‚Äôs microfinance portfolio, the largest among States; with outstanding loans at ‚Çπ57,712 crore, those caught in the debt trap have little hope that the ongoing election will change their plight

title: ‚Çπ21-crore detailed project report prepared for development of Kapavaram Buddhist site
content: The State will seek financial support from the Ministry of Culture under the Scheme of Financial Assistance for the Development of Buddhist/Tibetan Culture and Art, says Rajanagaram MLA

title: Centre undermining local languages to prioritise Sanskrit: Hampana
content: ‚ÄòThe Union government is pushing for One Language, One Nation, One Election while systematically stifling people‚Äôs languages. A major portion of the language funding is being used to promote Sanskrit alone‚Äô

title: Poor can‚Äôt access justice until they are aware of their rights, says PM Modi
content: At the inauguration of a conference on legal aid delivery mechanisms, PM Modi stresses the importance of legal awareness and justice delivery in a language understood by the recipient

title: Digital abuse against women journalists cannot be normalised as part of ‚Äòonline discourse‚Äô: CJI-designate Justice Surya Kant
content: ‚ÄòThese perpetrators, instead of engaging with their actual work or the opinions expressed by women journalists, utilise these methods of ‚Äòonline violence‚Äô to belittle, induce fear, and discredit them professionally,‚Äô Justice Kant said, speaking at the Indian Women‚Äôs Press Corps

title: In Seemanchal, voters fight poverty, migration and floods
content: Failing to form an alliance with the Opposition, Owaisi‚Äôs AIMIM is all out to dent INDIA bloc‚Äôs vote share. However, it is unlikely to make much impact despite the significant Muslim population in Seemanchal. The BJP is making an attempt to change the mood by raising the issue of alleged infiltration.

title: Over 70% of India‚Äôs prisoners have not yet been found guilty: SC judge
content: Of the 74% undertrials, only 7.91% utilised legal aid available to them, as most of the accused don‚Äôt even know that they have a right to free legal aid, says Justice Vikram Nath during release of NALSAR report

title: GBA Chief instructs officials to speed up pothole-filling works; deploys more teams
content: Maheshwar Rao directs officials to give top priority to pending potholes on arterial and sub-arterial roads

title: Littering mars Kozhikode beach food street soon after opening
content: Videos of garbage piling up went viral a day after launch, with Corporation officials attributing the mess to a lack of civic sense among visitors despite adequate waste management measures

title: APCRDA gets ‚Çπ7,500 crore loan for development of Amaravati LPS villages
content: Infrastructure works related to basic amenities, development and others in 29 villages will commence on November 21, says MA&UD Minister

title: Ghana invites Singareni to invest in its mining sector
content: Singareni CMD agrees to send a delegation to the African country soon to explore business opportunities

title: Special operation against red sandalwood smugglers soon, says Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan
content: Calling for an end to the illegal trade voluntarily, he says the government will soon seize the assets of four kingpins involved in the clandestine activity

title: A night of horrors
content: The gruesome events that unfolded in Coimbatore on the night of November 2 and early the next day, and the harrowing experience of a young couple in love, have shocked the nation. Wilson Thomas examines the sequence of events and follows up on the action taken since.

title: Mother Eliswa Vakayil, first nun of Kerala‚Äôs Catholic Church, declared Blessed
content: The declaration, made 112 years after her death, was attended by thousands of devotees, clergy and representatives of different religious orders

title: In final campaign push, PM urges voters to keep away ‚Äòjungle raj‚Äô for Bihar‚Äôs development
content: Home Minister Amit Shah promises the people that the government would make Bihar flood-free and the rivers coming from Nepal that cause destruction would be connected to those rivers to channel the floodwater to the farmers‚Äô fields

title: ED attaches eight more properties worth ‚Çπ67 crore in PFI case
content: The Enforcement Directorate previously attached assets worth ‚Çπ61.98 crore through nine orders, confirmed by the Adjudicating Authority under the PMLA, bringing the total attachments to ‚Çπ129 crore

title: ADGP visits Belagavi hospital, enquires about health of policemen injured in stone pelting
content: Additional Director-General of Police (Law and Order)¬†Hitendra R. on Saturday visited a private hospital in Belagavi to enquire about the health of police personnel who were injured in the stone-pelting incident near Hattaragi toll booth in Hukkeri taluk of Belagavi district

title: Death in Thiruvananthapuram MCH: Chennithala extends help to Venu‚Äôs family
content: The Congress leader assures health insurance cover of ‚Çπ10 lakh for Venu‚Äôs family and says he will personally pay the annual premium

title: UDF‚Äôs seat-sharing in Kottayam stalls as allies firm on their demands
content: The Congress party is wary of Kerala Congress (Joseph faction)‚Äôs demand to contest in nine seats and the IUML‚Äôs claim to the Mundakayam seat. Seat-sharing negotiations among the UDF constituents in Kottayam reaches a critical impasse with each side standing firm on their demands.

title: Puttaparthi gears up for Modi, Naidu visit for Sathya Sai Baba centenary celebrations
content: Collector and SP review key venues and direct officials to ensure foolproof security and smooth coordination

title: Cyber fraudsters dupe ‚Çπ2.16 crore of pharma company by hacking into its email communication
content: hackers reportedly gained unauthorised access to the company‚Äôs email system and sent a spoofed message from a fake ID impersonating an official representative of the company

title: Laity confused about Vatican‚Äôs statement on Virgin Mary‚Äôs title
content: Vatican‚Äôs doctrinal office says ‚Äòco-redemptrix‚Äô is not an appropriate title for Virgin Mary, leaving the faithful uncertain about her role in their spiritual life. Syro-Malabar Church Major Archbishop issues a circular saying that the directive is not new and is just a clarification. The clergy maintain that Mary is an integral part of the Catholic Church‚Äôs faith and practices

title: Woman artist booked for filming reel on Guruvayur temple premises
content: Case registered against artist Jasna Salim for allegedly filming a reel at the ‚ÄòNadapandal‚Äô of the shrine recently

title: Vaiko to undertake padayatra against drug use and alcohol consumption
content: He says he will start the programme on January 2, 2026 from Tiruchi and conclude it in Madurai, covering 175 km

title: 'Bounty of concerns': Massive US crackdown on H-1B visa abuse ‚Äî all you need to know
content: The Trump administration has launched 175 investigations into alleged H-1B visa program abuse, aiming to protect American jobs. These probes have uncovered over $15 million in unpaid wages and numerous violations, including fake worksites and underpaid foreign workers. The administration asserts these measures will prevent wage suppression and prioritize American workers.

title: From toasted to roasted: Sale of Trump wines in military cantonments invite flak
content: US military stores are reportedly selling Trump-branded wines, sparking ethical concerns despite official claims of legality. This incident echoes broader accusations of the Trump family's self-enrichment, including a crypto venture with Pakistan that critics allege strained US-India ties. Lavish White House events during a government shutdown also drew sharp criticism for insensitivity.

title: 'Certain military elements': Taliban targets Pak army; accuses it of creating tension
content: Afghanistan's Taliban spokesperson accused Pakistani military elements of pursuing anti-Afghanistan policies and exploiting the country's instability for years. He rejected claims linking the TTP's rise to the Taliban's return, stating both issues predate their takeover and stem from misguided Pakistani military actions. The Taliban asserted Pakistan's instability is an internal matter and affirmed their commitment to preventing cross-border militancy.

title: Shocking revelation! How SRK saved Pujara‚Äôs career - 'He offered to fly him'
content: A remarkable tale of Kolkata Knight Riders' player welfare has surfaced. In 2009, Cheteshwar Pujara suffered a career-threatening ACL tear during a KKR practice match. The franchise, led by Shah Rukh Khan, personally ensured Pujara received top-tier surgery in Cape Town, covering all logistics and family support, ultimately aiding his successful recovery and illustrious Test career.

title: Future of AI: 'I would have dropped out if...'; Nvidia CEO's message to Zuckerberg
content: Nvidia's Jensen Huang and Meta's Mark Zuckerberg shared insights on AI's future and building tech empires. Huang humorously wished he'd dropped out like Zuckerberg, while both acknowledged their long journeys and mutual admiration. Nvidia's remarkable rise to a $5 trillion valuation was highlighted, contrasting with Zuckerberg's own dorm-room beginnings leading to Meta's trillion-dollar status.

title: Bihar polls: Will 'Modi magic' help Nitish defy 20 yrs of anti-incumbency?
content: Bihar chief minister Nitish Kumar faces a significant political challenge in the 2025 assembly polls.  After nearly two decades, voter fatigue is evident. Can Prime Minister Narendra Modi's enduring popularity and the BJP's national strength help Nitish Kumar retain power?

title: ‚ÄòRahul‚Äôs dukaan will be shut‚Äô: Amit Shah attacks Cong-RJD; says INDIA bloc will be wiped out
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah launched a sharp attack on Rahul Gandhi and the INDIA bloc in Bihar, predicting their electoral wipeout. Shah accused the opposition of harboring infiltrators and warned against the return of 'jungle raj' under the RJD. He also took a dig at Lalu Prasad and Sonia Gandhi, highlighting concerns over their sons' political futures.

title: 'We make it clear...': Bill Gates on Gates Foundation; says 'no replacement for govt funding'
content: The Gates Foundation has pledged $2.5 billion over five years to advance global women's health, marking a significant increase in their investment. This funding will primarily support research and development for innovations like self-injectable contraceptives and rapid STI diagnostics, aiming to address long-overlooked health disparities and catalyze broader action.

title: Chess WC: Gukesh out! Top-seeded foreigner Anish Giri too exits
content: Four Indian chess stars have reached the fourth round of the FIDE World Cup 2025. R Praggnanandhaa, Arjun Erigaisi, and Pranav V secured their spots. However, World Champion Gukesh D faced elimination. Several other Indian players will compete in tiebreaks. The tournament features top players from around the globe vying for the Viswanathan Anand Cup.

title: Candace Owens fires back at Ben Shapiro over Erika Kirk accusation claim
content: Candace Owens vehemently denied accusing Erika Kirk of her husband Charlie Kirk's death, calling Ben Shapiro a liar for his claims on The Megyn Kelly Show. Owens stated Shapiro fabricated the accusation to discredit her. Meanwhile, Erika Kirk appealed for public grace following her husband's passing, emphasizing the impact of online discourse on her children.

title: Delhi chokes: AQI crosses 400; why is GRAP 3 not yet enforced?
content: Delhi's air quality has entered the 'red zone' with AQI crossing 400, making it the country's second most polluted city. Despite hazardous levels in several areas, Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) Stage 3 has not been enforced due to comparatively better air quality this November than last year, attributed to coordinated pollution control measures.

title: ‚ÄòNot about compensation‚Äô: Twitter founder defends Musk‚Äôs $1Tn pay; quotes Tesla‚Äôs old post
content: Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey has publicly supported Tesla CEO Elon Musk's proposed $1 trillion pay package. Dorsey stated the compensation is about ensuring a principled engineering approach for the company's future. This support comes as Tesla shareholders prepare to vote on the package at their annual general meeting today, November 6.

title: Pak on brink of hunger crisis? Flour shortage deepens; prices hit the roof
content: Pakistan's twin cities face a severe flour shortage as wheat supplies to mills halt, sparking panic and raising food security concerns.  Prices have doubled, impacting bakers and consumers.  Compounding the crisis are transport blockades and dwindling water levels, creating a dire situation for millions.

title: Man claims he suffered eardrum damage after using noise-cancelling earbuds for two years
content: A user's alarming experience of sudden ear pain leading to a perforated eardrum after two years of using 50dB noise-cancelling earbuds has sparked widespread concern. Experts warn that while ANC tech can reduce volume needs, prolonged use and potential pressure can pose serious health risks. Users are urged to monitor usage duration and volume levels to protect ear health.

title: Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs ‚Äògoodbye‚Äô text hours before death highlights NFL crisis
content: Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs death at 24 has forced the NFL to confront a serious mental health crisis. Police confirmed the Dallas Cowboys defensive end died by an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound after alarming messages to family. Coaches, teammates, and fans are grieving as dispatch audio reveals the severity of his final hours. Full details inside.

title: Klay Thompson apologises to Megan Thee Stallion after airport pickup mishap
content: Dallas Mavericks star Klay Thompson went viral for his heartfelt apology and remorse after arriving late to pick up girlfriend Megan Thee Stallion from the airport. He presented her with flowers, expressing genuine regret, which fans found "adorably human." The couple's authentic connection continues to charm audiences as they both thrive in their careers.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs wife Lauren Kyle drops ‚ÄòOilers Collection 03‚Äô racing-inspired line
content: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, has unveiled "Oilers Collection 03," a new capsule inspired by classic motorsport style. The collection blends the Oilers' iconic colors with high-end streetwear and automotive aesthetics, drawing from vintage racing suits and team heritage. Kyle shared a preview on Instagram, highlighting the performance-driven fashion.

title: Bihar polls: VVPAT slips found on roadside; election official suspended, EC clarifies
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar assured the public that the election's integrity remains intact despite VVPAT slips found roadside in Bihar's Samastipur. These were from mock polls, not actual voting. The assistant returning officer responsible has been suspended for negligence, and an FIR is being filed. The Election Commission acted swiftly after a video of the incident went viral.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Fire and fire' - Suryakumar Yadav hails explosive Shubman-Abhishek duo
content: Captain Suryakumar Yadav strongly backed Shubman Gill's T20 approach, praising his aggressive partnership with Abhishek Sharma.  Despite past strike rate concerns, Gill's recent unbeaten 29 off 16 balls showcased his evolving game.  Yadav highlighted their 'fire and fire' chemistry and adaptability, reinforcing the team's faith in Gill's T20 capabilities.

title: 'Dangerous move': Kerala CM on RSS song at Vande Bharat launch; takes shot at Railways
content: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan has strongly condemned Southern Railway for allegedly having school students sing an RSS song during the Vande Bharat Express inauguration. He called it a "blatant violation of constitutional principles" and accused the Railways of subverting national institutions with "Sangh Parivar politics." MP John Brittas also criticized the move, deeming the inauguration "highly politicised."

title: Pak army spooked: Munir moves to grab more power; did Op Sindoor trigger panic?
content: Pakistan is fortifying its military command structure by tabling a constitutional amendment, citing lessons from India tensions. The move aims to formally enshrine the ranks of service chiefs and potentially create a 'Commander of Defence Forces,' raising concerns about increased military power over civilian government.

title: ‚ÄòEase of justice key to ease of living, business‚Äô: PM Modi hails legal reforms
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized that 'ease of justice' is crucial for ease of living and doing business, ensuring accessibility for all citizens. He highlighted the government's efforts in faster, inclusive justice delivery through Lok Adalats and the legal aid defence counsel system, resolving millions of disputes and aiding marginalized sections.

title: Inside Bengaluru jail: Rapist, criminals seen using phones, watching TV; probe on
content: Videos have emerged showing convicted serial rapist Umesh Reddy and terror case accused Tarun Raju using mobile phones and other privileges inside Bengaluru's Parappana Agrahara Central Jail. The Karnataka Prison Department has launched an investigation into how the inmates accessed the devices and if prison officials were complicit, with strict action promised if lapses are found.

title: Delhi govt launches ‚ÄòSchool Web App‚Äô; digital leap for schools; education gets smarter
content: The Delhi government has launched the School Web App, a comprehensive digital platform designed to transform how schools operate and deliver education. Introduced by Education Minister Ashish Sood, the initiative aligns with the Digital India and Viksit Bharat 2047 vision, aiming to enhance transparency, efficiency, and accessibility. While the app promises seamless communication and accountability, challenges such as the digital divide, cybersecurity, and over-reliance on technology highlight the need for balanced and inclusive implementation.

title: IND vs AUS | 'I was preparing ...': Abhishek reveals planning behind 'Man of the Series' show
content: Abhishek Sharma's Player of the Series award in Australia was a result of months of mental and technical preparation for bouncy pitches and fast bowlers. He expressed excitement for the series and credited the Indian think-tank for giving him the confidence to play freely. Sharma is now focused on securing a spot in the T20 World Cup squad.

title: 'Why didn't they stop infiltrators?' Kharge calls Bihar 'double engine' govt 'failure'‚Äã‚Äã
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge has dismissed the BJP's claims of winning over 160 seats in the Bihar Assembly elections. He stated that the people will decide the final outcome. Kharge also questioned the ruling alliance's failure to address law and order issues and illegal infiltration. Union home minister Amit Shah had earlier projected a sweeping victory for the NDA.

title: Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs cousin alleges police killed him, says he fled in fear
content: Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland tragically died after a police chase, leaving family questioning law enforcement's role. Days after his first NFL touchdown, Kneeland crashed his car and fled, his body later found in a porta-potty.  Family insists he wasn't suicidal or on drugs, fearing foul play.

title: Caitlin Clark turns heads at Butler Bulldogs game with new Indiana Fever coach Rob Dosier
content: Caitlin Clark was spotted at a Butler University basketball game during her WNBA offseason, accompanied by new Indiana Fever player development coach Rob Dosier. Clark's presence was unsurprising due to her boyfriend's coaching role at Butler. This outing comes as Clark recovers from an injury-plagued season and prepares for a golf tournament.

title: 2027 WC: Kohli, Rohit face serious warning - 'You're not irreplaceable'
content: Former Australian captain Steve Waugh believes no cricketer is irreplaceable, addressing the dilemma faced by chief selector Ajit Agarkar regarding Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's 2027 ODI World Cup prospects.  While the duo aims for the tournament, their age presents a challenge. Agarkar must balance player sentiment with team performance, a tough call Waugh emphasizes.

title: 'Bhaiya, what're you doing': Woman says Rapido driver tried to grab her legs; firm replies
content: A woman in Bengaluru has accused a Rapido bike taxi rider of inappropriate behaviour. She reported the rider attempted to grab her legs during a journey. The incident has prompted an investigation by Bengaluru City Police. Rapido has expressed concern and stated that passenger safety is a top priority. The company is looking into the matter.

title: Big relief! Rishabh Pant eases injury fears after retiring hurt; returns to bat
content: India A captain Rishabh Pant returned to bat after retiring hurt due to multiple blows from a pacer. This eased injury concerns for the team management and fans ahead of the upcoming Test series against South Africa. Pant's resilience signals his readiness for the crucial home Tests.

title: 'No proof of Sita‚Äôs birthplace‚Äô: Congress digs up old BJP remark; demands PM's apology
content: Congress slammed PM Modi's Sitamarhi rally, citing a 2017 culture ministry statement denying historical proof of Goddess Sita's birth there. Jairam Ramesh demanded an apology, accusing the BJP of neglecting Bihar's religious sites and cancelling a key rail project. Meanwhile, Amit Shah announced an Rs 850-crore Sita temple project for the region.

title: IND vs AUS: Rain washes out Brisbane decider; India seal T20I series 2-1
content: India secured a 2-1 series victory over Australia in their T20 International series after the final match at the Gabba was abandoned due to rain. Despite a strong start from India's openers, the weather ultimately decided the series outcome. The win provides a significant confidence boost for India ahead of the upcoming T20 World Cup.

title: 'Fighting Mahatma's battle': Priyanka targets PM Modi; calls for 'change' in Bihar
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra stated that the Congress and Mahagathbandhan are fighting for citizens' rights and democracy, drawing parallels to Mahatma Gandhi's struggle against an 'empire of Narendra Modi.' She accused the BJP of attempting to weaken the Constitution and 'steal' votes, amid ongoing opposition claims of electoral manipulation.

title: Record! Jurel becomes 2nd India A batter to achieve this rare feat
content: Dhruv Jurel achieved a rare feat by scoring centuries in both innings of an 'A-Test' against South Africa A, becoming just the second Indian to do so. His composed 127* helped India A extend their lead significantly. Meanwhile, Rishabh Pant retired hurt but returned to play a brisk 65, easing fitness concerns ahead of the upcoming Test series.

title: Cowboys coach‚Äôs regret revealed: ‚ÄòI should have known‚Äô after Kneeland‚Äôs silence
content: Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs death has shaken the NFL as new details surface about his final hours, including goodbye texts, police dispatch audio, and emotional comments from former Cowboys assistant Greg Ellis. The coach revealed he saw signs of struggle and now regrets not checking in more.

title: Gaza ceasefire: Khan Younis hospital receives 15 bodies from Israel; aid still delayed
content: Under the US-brokered ceasefire, Gaza's Nasser Hospital received 15 Palestinian bodies from Israel, following the return of an Israeli hostage's remains. This exchange adheres to an agreement where Israel returns 15 Palestinian bodies for each Israeli hostage released. The deal also mandates increased aid to Gaza, though a significant portion remains unadmitted.

title: Missed flight, cleared no gate: How British national slipped past Delhi immigration; hunt on
content: A British national, Fitz Patrick, allegedly bypassed immigration formalities at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport after arriving from Bangkok. He was discovered missing during routine checks, prompting an investigation into how he exited the terminal. Authorities are utilizing CCTV footage and intelligence to trace his whereabouts.

title: Delhi airport tech snag: Normalcy restored a day after 800+ flight delays; advisory issued
content: Operations at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport have returned to normal following a technical glitch in the Air Traffic Control's flight planning system. The issue, which affected the Automatic Message Switching System, led to widespread flight delays yesterday. Authorities are working to minimize passenger inconvenience.

title: China's war on global academic freedom: UK varsity halts study on Uyghurs
content: A UK university's temporary halt on Uyghur forced labour research, reportedly due to Chinese student market access fears, has sparked global debate on academic freedom. Sheffield Hallam University reversed its decision after backlash, but the incident highlights Beijing's growing leverage over institutions. This controversy coincides with intensified global Uyghur advocacy efforts.

title: 'My question was misunderstood': YouTuber apologises to actor Gouri Kishan after backlash
content: YouTuber R. S. Karthik apologized to actress Gouri Kishan. He faced criticism for asking about her weight at a film press conference. Kishan responded strongly, calling the question disrespectful. Many celebrities supported her stand. Karthik stated his question was misunderstood. The incident has reignited discussions on body-shaming and media conduct towards actresses.

title: "There Is No 'Ahindu' In India": RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh chief Mohan Bhagwat on Saturday said that Hindus are "responsible" for Bharat, asserting that the RSS aims to organise Hindu society for the glory of the nation, not for power.

title: Rajasthan Woman Strangles Newborn Hours After Birth
content: A 40-year-old woman allegedly strangled her newborn son to death, just hours after giving birth at a government hospital in Rajasthan's Churu district.

title: Air Quality Body Urges Punjab To Curb Stubble Burning Incidents
content: The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) on Saturday called for urgent and coordinated action by Punjab to curb stubble burning incidents, even as it said that Haryana has shown a significant decline in such cases

title: Karnataka Woman, 65, Killed For Gold, Accused Dumps Body Near Lake
content: An elderly woman was murdered, her body kept hidden inside a house for two days, and later dumped near a lake, said police in Karnataka.

title: After NDTV Report, Children Finally Get Steel Plates For Midday Meals In Madhya Pradesh School
content: Two days after NDTV's report revealed that students at Hullpur Government School in Sheopur were being served their midday meals on sheets of waste paper, the district administration swung into action.

title: Delhi Records Season's Coldest Night So Far At 11 Degrees Celsius
content: The onset of winter in the national capital was perceptible with a crisp chill in the air on Saturday.

title: Justice Must Be Delivered In Language Understood By The Recipient: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday advocated for simplifying the language of law so that it is easily understood by the local populace and said ease of justice must be ensured for every citizen.

title: Cleaner Start To November, Yet Delhi's Air Far From Safe, Data Shows
content: Delhi's air may be showing signs of improvement compared to last year, but it's still far from clean.

title: Delhi Chief Minister Urges Carpooling, Work From Home Amid 'Severe' AQI
content: As Delhi's air quality entered the "severe" category in multiple areas on Saturday, Chief Minister Rekha Gupta announced a targeted push to eliminate traditional cooking fuels in slum clusters, while ramping up citywide anti-pollution drives.

title: Man Who Instructed Girlfriend To Hide Camera In Tata Women's Hostel Arrested
content: The boyfriend of a woman who had installed a hidden camera in a bathroom of a women's hostel in Tamil Nadu's Hosur was arrested in Delhi on Friday.

title: As More Bodies Are Exchanged, Palestinian Death Count In Gaza Crosses 69,000
content: Gaza health officials said Saturday that over 69,000 Palestinians have been killed in the Israel-Hamas war so far, as Israel and Hamas completed the latest exchange of bodies under the terms of the tenuous ceasefire agreement.

title: Vet Deals Even If You Have To "Pay Fees": Ajit Pawar's Advice For Son Amid Land Row
content: Facing a volley of attacks from the Opposition over the alleged sale of government land in Pune worth Rs 1,800 crore for just Rs 300 crore to a firm in which his son is a partner,  Ajit Pawar has said it should not have happened.

title: ISIS Recruiter, Rapist, Criminals Seen Using Phones, Watching TV Inside Bengaluru Jail
content: Allegations of major security lapses and preferential treatment at Bengaluru's Parappana Agrahara Central jail have surfaced after videos showed notorious inmates, including an ISIS recruiter, using mobile phones and watching television.

title: 15-Year-Old Dragged Inside School Compound, Gang-Raped In Madhya Pradesh
content: A 15-year-old girl was gang-raped by two men and a minor inside the premises of a government primary school in Madhya Pradesh's Mauganj district on Friday.

title: DiCaprio Funds Brazilian Environmentalist After False Forest Fire Claims By Bolsonaro
content: Being falsely accused of setting fire in the Amazon with funds from an Oscar-winning actor eventually became a blessing in disguise for Caetano Scannavino, the founder of a nonprofit organisation in the heart of the rainforest.

title: "No Question Of Saving Anybody": Devendra Fadnavis On Pune Land Deal Row
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said action in the Pune land deal case is being taken as per law and there is no question of saving anybody.

title: PM Modi Meets Veteran BJP Leader LK Advani, Extends Birthday Wishes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday met veteran BJP leader and Bharat Ratna awardee Lal Krishna Advani at his residence and extended birthday greetings, wishing him good health and a long life.

title: 'Relationship With My Brother Is Over Forever': Tej Pratap Yadav To NDTV
content: Tej Pratap Yadav, the estranged son of Rashtriya Janata Dal chief Lalu Yadav, wants to blaze his own trail and not live under the shadow of his younger brother, Tejashwi Yadav.

title: 'Hindu Society In Prime Of Its Glory, Wants To Unite World': Mohan Bhagwat
content: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) Sarsanghchalak Mohan Bhagwat said on Saturday that Hindu society is at the height of its glory, and always wants to unite the world.

title: 2-Year-Old Attacked By Stray Dog In Maharashtra's Thane
content: A two-year-old girl sustained serious injuries after being attacked by a stray dog in Maharashtra' Thane district.

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: Week 11 intel: Auburn fallout, Texas' moves and biggest visits
content: the recruiting trail has heated up this week as the clock ticks down on the 2026 class . Ohio State, Texas and Texas Tech are among the programs charging for late-cycle flips . the market for premium defensive tackles, led by fall decommits Danny Beale, Dylan Berymon and Emanuel Ruffin, is intensifying this month .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Every team's current pace vs. preseason projections
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . this edition of the Power Rankings will be taking a look at the preseason over/under point totals compared to each team's current points pace .

title: Rankings, contract projections for top 50 MLB free agents
content: the free agency offseason kicks off at 5 p.m. ET on friday . it's time to rank the 2025-26 free agent class and predict how much money each player will get . the goal is to predict what will happen, not decide what each player is worth .

title: Don't be surprised if ... Lamar Jackson, Rashid Shaheed thrive down the stretch
content: Rashid Shaheed averaged 11.6 fantasy points, on pace for 83 receptions and 943 receiving yards . Shaheed was a reasonable, deep-league flex option who simply needed better quarterback play . he averaged an ordinary 11.3 yards per catch with QBs Spencer Rattler .

title: 13 more Week 10 games, 13 matchup previews: We have predictions, picks and wild stats
content: the NFL schedule for the 2025 season brings some exciting matchups . the game will be played between the Falcons and Colts in the u.s. back in the states, Drake Maye and Baker Mayfield will face off in a QB duel .

title: Why was Ja Morant suspended? What we know about the latest Grizzlies drama
content: grizzlies guard Ja Morant is frustrated with his joy for the game of basketball . the Grizzlies are frustrated, too, suspending Morant for a game over the weekend because of conduct detrimental to the team . morant missed the loss to the Toronto Raptors on Sunday, then had 18 points .

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Randy Brown could get an upset win at UFC Fight Night
content: welterweight title fight tops next week's UFC 322 fight card . Neither Brown nor Bonfim are ranked in the MMA divisional rankings . the first of two consecutive weeks of main events takes place on saturday .

content: the Bilas Index is the most powerful and consequential instrument of basketball wisdom and judgment known to humankind . it serves as much more than a guide or a road map to this men's college basketball season . the Bilastrator's immense and powerful brain is superior in processing basketball performance, potential and ability .

title: The NFL at midseason: Separating the good, bad and ugly for all 32 teams
content: quarterback carousel spins in Arizona, New Orleans and San Francisco with injuries . quarterback jaxson Dart has impressed as a rookie QB in new york . the nfl is one of the strongest divisions halfway through the season . "get up" team reporters took part in a midseason reset .

title: Donald Trump endorses Vivek Ramaswamy in crucial Ohio governor's race
content: entrepreneur vivek Ramaswamy is vying to become the first non-white governor in Ohio's 223-year history . all 64 previous governors have been white men, a streak unbroken since statehood in 1803 . "this isn't just about policy‚Äîit's about shattering ceilings," he said .

title: 'Three targets': UK gave Canada intel on Nijjar killing; shocking claim in documentary
content: GCHQ handed a dossier to Ottawa of intercepted communications . it alleges the Indian government was behind various plots to kill Khalistan separatists . the documentary claims the intelligence agency was the one intercepting conversations between individuals discussing potential targets .
